projects.title: Escape from the Roots
projects.description: Project created for the Global Game Jam, whose theme was 'Roots'. It's a 2d horror game where the aim is to escape from the maze without getting caught by the roots.

projects.title: 42sh
projects.description: The project involves developing a UNIX command interpreter, similar to the TCSH shell. The aim is to be able to execute basic commands, handle errors, environment variables and built-in commands such as cd, setenv, unsetenv, env and exit. The interpreter manage the search for executables in the PATH and display a prompt to wait for user commands.

projects.title: MyHunter
projects.description: The project involves creating a small video game inspired by Duck Hunt. The player takes the role of a hunter who shoot ducks that appear on the screen. The game handle user input, display animated sprites and allow the player to move and shoot the ducks. The aim is to create a fun game while respecting the rules and functionalities required.

projects.title: Radar
projects.description: The project consists in developing an air traffic simulation. The program displays a 2D visualization panel where aircraft and control towers move according to predefined rules. Aircraft move in straight lines, taking off, landing and colliding, while control towers have circular control zones. The aim is to create a realistic simulation, respecting the required functionalities and allowing the user to interact with the visualization.

projects.title: BSQ
projects.description: The project involves finding the largest possible square on a grid, avoiding obstacles. The grid can be generated from a file or using parameters for width, height and a repeated pattern. The program display the grid with the cells of the largest square replaced by 'x'. The aim is to find the highest solution and, in the case of several solutions, to choose the leftmost square.

projects.title: Sokoban
projects.description: The project involves developing a terminal-mode version of the Sokoban game using the ncurses library. The player has to move crates around a warehouse, pushing the crates to storage locations. The game is over when all the crates have been placed on the storage locations. The program is able to handle the resizing of the terminal and the arrow keys for the player's movements.

projects.title: Antman
projects.description: The project involves the development of two programs, 'antman' and 'giantman', for compressing and decompressing files respectively. The aim is to implement a lossless compression algorithm to reduce file size while guaranteeing exact recovery of the original data during decompression. The programs have to take account of different file types, such as text files, HTML files and PPM images, and have to work efficiently even on large files.

projects.title: Push Swap
projects.description: The project consists in developing a program that sorts a list of numbers using a limited set of operations. The program will take as input an unsorted list and produce a sequence of operations that sorts the list with the fewest possible operations. The aim is to implement an efficient algorithm to solve this sorting problem in an optimal way.

projects.title: Biker Neon
projects.description: A mobile video game inspired by the famous Rider game

projects.title: MyPaint
projects.description: The project involves developing a drawing program similar to 'Paint' using a graphical user interface. The program is to enable the user to draw using tools such as pencil and eraser, and to modify the parameters of these tools. It also offer features such as image saving in different formats.

projects.title: MyRpg
projects.description: The project involves creating a complete role-playing game (RPG) using the C language. The game offer a pleasant user interface, a coherent universe with appropriate graphics and sounds, and a fun gameplay experience with objectives to achieve. It also include player features, combat, inventory, quests, and allow the player to gain experience and progress through the game.

projects.title: Dante's Star
projects.description: The project involves generating mazes, finding the exit path and solving the mazes as quickly as possible. The project also includes performance measurement and optimization of the algorithms used.

projects.title: Lem-in
projects.description: The project involves simulating a computer called 'Hex', which functions like an anthill with rooms and tunnels. The aim is to find the fastest way to get the ants from the entrance to the exit of this virtual anthill, avoiding traffic jams and taking the shortest route.

projects.title: Need4Stek
projects.description: The project consists in creating an autonomous car using Lidar, capable of driving on a virtual track without hitting walls or driving in the wrong direction. The aim is to develop high-performance artificial intelligence to control the car using the CoppeliaSim simulator.

projects.title: Popeye
projects.description: The project involves containerizing and deploying a web survey application. The aim is to master the basics of containerization and describe a multi-container infrastructure using Docker and Docker Compose.

projects.title: Chocolatine
projects.description: The project involves setting up a workflow with GitHub Actions to apply best practices and various rules in a code repository. The aim is to automate the process of code style verification, program compilation and test execution.

projects.title: GameZen
projects.description: GameZen is a plugin that automatically activates Do Not Disturb mode on Discord when a game is launched. It aims to provide an uninterrupted gaming experience by automatically adjusting the user's status. This allows users to concentrate fully on their game without being disturbed by unwanted notifications or messages.

projects.title: Corewar
projects.description: Corewar is a game project in which several programs called Champions fight to be the last alive. It's a computer simulation where processors share memory for execution. The aim of the project is to create a virtual machine in which Champions fight for memory, and the last Champion to execute the live instruction is declared the winner.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: This project is a website portfolio made to present my computer science projects. It is a one-page responsive website programmed with React, HTML, CSS, and TypeScript

projects.title: SpotifyClone
projects.description: This project aims to replicate the functionality of the popular music streaming platform, Spotify. It provides a user-friendly interface where users can search for and play music, create playlists, and browse through different genres and artists. With this clone, users can enjoy a similar music streaming experience as they would on Spotify, but with the added benefit of being able to customize and modify the codebase to suit their needs.

projects.title: Ecommerce-Admin
projects.description: The project is an admin dashboard for managing an e-commerce store, built using Next.js and React. This powerful tool serves as a CMS, admin interface, and API, providing extensive control over multiple vendors and stores. The admin dashboard is designed with Shadcn UI for a sleek and user-friendly experience. It empowers administrators to efficiently handle categories, products, filters, billboards, and more, all while offering seamless integration with Clerk Authentication and Stripe payment functionalities.

projects.title: Ecommerce-Store
projects.description: This project is an ecommerce store built using Next.js and React. It allows users to browse and purchase products based on categories and sizes. The store fetches data from API endpoints to display products, billboards, and categories. It also includes functionality for adding items to the shopping cart. Overall, the project provides a user-friendly interface for online shopping and offers a seamless experience for browsing and purchasing products.

projects.title: TaskManagement
projects.description: This project is a web application inspired by Trello. It's designed to manage tasks and projects within organizations and workspaces. The application is built with a MySQL database and Prisma ORM, and the UI is developed using shadcnUI & TailwindCSS.

projects.title: MiniLibC
projects.description: This project involves creating a dynamic ELF library in x86-64 assembly to replace standard C library functions like strlen, memcpy, and strcmp, aiming to deepen understanding of low-level programming and system interactions using custom implementations.

projects.title: Wolfram
projects.description: This project aims to implement Wolfram's elementary cellular automaton in the terminal. The cellular automaton operates within an infinite space, allowing unseen areas to affect future generations.

projects.title: MyFTP
projects.description: This project aims to develop a FTP server adhering to the specified protocol ensuring RFC959 compliance. It involves implementing request sequences outlined in the protocol, utilizing TCP sockets for network communication.

projects.title: NanoTekSpice
projects.description: This project aims to develop NanoTekSpice, a logic simulator that constructs a graph representing digital electronic components from a configuration file, allowing the injection of values to obtain results.

projects.title: Image Compressor
projects.description: This project aims to implement an image compressor using the k-means algorithm for clustering colors, focusing on regrouping pixel colors into clusters and replacing them with the cluster's mean color to reduce the number of colors in the image.

projects.title: Arcade
projects.description: This project involves creating Arcade, a gaming platform that allows users to select and play games while tracking player scores. It requires implementing games and graphics libraries as dynamic libraries loaded at runtime. GUIs are to be used as shared libraries dynamically by the main program. Games and graphics libraries, including Ncurses.so, SDL2, and SFML, are provided, featuring games like Snake and Pacman, ensuring game logic remains independent from graphics libraries.

projects.title: MyTeams
projects.description: This project aims to develop a server and a CLI client, establishing a custom protocol documented in RFC style. It involves creating a data model adhering to library technical properties, implementing required commands in the CLI client, and utilizing provided server and client libraries to print all events and data. Network communication will be facilitated via TCP sockets.

projects.title: MyPandoc
projects.description: This project aims to develop a simplified version of Pandoc, allowing interaction with documents by converting them between formats such as JSON, XML, and Markdown.

projects.title: Raytracer
projects.description: This project involves creating a raytracer program capable of generating images based on a scene description file. The program support primitives like spheres and planes, transformations including translation, and lighting features such as directional and ambient light. It output images to a PPM file. The scene configuration is defined in an external file.

projects.title: Panoramix
projects.description: This project aims to delve into thread and mutex programming by simulating a scenario where villagers consume magic potions to battle Roman soldiers. The program emulate this behavior, with each villager and the druid running in separate threads. The use of semaphores and mutexes is mandatory to ensure synchronization, and the program gracefully stop when all villagers' threads have concluded.

projects.title: The Plazza
projects.description: This project aims to simulate a pizzeria, featuring a reception for new orders, multiple kitchens with several cooks, and the preparation of various pizzas. You'll address challenges such as load balancing, process and thread synchronization, and communication, utilizing tools like processes, inter-process communication (IPC), STL threads, and POSIX threads.

projects.title: Taskify
projects.description: Taskify is a comprehensive task management platform that combines the best features of Notion, Trello, and Jira. Built with Next.js, it offers multiple views (Kanban, Table, Calendar) for task organization within workspaces and projects. Key features include workspace invitation system, image upload capabilities, advanced search and filtering, analytics dashboard, and role-based permissions. The platform leverages Appwrite SDK for backend services, implements OAuth and email authentication, and exposes a RESTful API built with Hono.js. The responsive design is crafted using Shadcn UI and TailwindCSS, ensuring a seamless experience across all devices.
